body: You can assign it to us @pgundlach if you don't mind @caarlos0? Because we found the code that caused that issue, we also noticed that there were other bugs. For example, the default template URL for GitLab is also wrong.

issue.title: fix: remove .git suffix by default from announcers

body:
We addressed some of the bugs in PR #2623. The other bug that we found is that we're using a `defaultMessageTemplate` variable store message of the announce, but this URL within this template is suitable for GitHub; in GitLab, the URL is a bit different, GitLab uses `/-/releases/v0.1.3.` for releases. So, we ensure that we are using the correct message template according to the git URL configured by the user. For example, if the user uses GitLab, we should prefer to use `defaultGitLabMessageTemplate.`

cc: @Dentrax @erkanzileli
I would say that to ensure correctness, the best idea is for the user to use the actual HTTPS URL on the template, as if the repo is cloned via SSH, `.GitURL` will be the SSH URL...

issue.title: [Bug]: announce: ensure correctness of the GitURL
issue.body:
### What happened?

If the repo is cloned via `SSH`, `.GitURL` will be the SSH URL, which will be consumed by `announce` pipe and send a notification to target. Eventually there will be an SSL URL instead of HTTP URL. [^1] [^2]



[^1]: https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/2622#issuecomment-958358917
[^2]: https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/pull/2623#pullrequestreview-795989193

### How can we reproduce this?

1. Clone the repo using `ssh`
2. Set an announce on the template
3. `.GitURL` eventually will be SSH URL instead of HTTPS

### goreleaser version

47d0e827436f3c2ed8caac9d7f508b2a862c0e00

### GoReleaser Check

- [X] goreleaser check shows no errors

### Search

- [X] I did search for other open and closed issues before opening this.

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

### Additional context

Some solutions to tackle this problem:
* We can mention that the `.GitURL` may not be an HTTP URL on the `template.md`. 
* Converting SSH URL to HTTPS URL in the announce stage?
* Separating to `.GitHTTPSURL` and `.GitSSHURL`?

cc: @developer-guy @erkanzileli

body: Thanks for merging the PR and pointing out this concern! We just threw an issue, so we don't forget! https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/2625
